captions.text:
- If I get home at 7:30
will I miss bedtime?

Because maybe I should
just go to The Grove
and get trousers before it closes at nine.

- Kids still awake and I feel
like I might murder them.
That is a joke, but also this is awful.
(upbeat instrumental music)
- I don't know, it's pretty much the same
as it is when we were dating

- [Man] I would say.
- [Woman] Yeah, more or less.
- But it's a little bit more,

there's some, like, code
words maybe that we use.
It saves time I think, right?
- I don't know.

- Yeah, you don't have
to impress me at all,
you don't have to spell things right.
- Maybe it's more boring at times.
- There's a lot of food related texting.
- Yeah, there's a lot of, like--
- Because it's coordinating meals.
- And you've built up such a long--
- Shorthand.

- [Man] Shorthand, yeah.
- [Woman] Yeah, yeah.
- It's direct, it's just information that
needs to happen just goes out.
- Yeah.

- And then every once in
awhile there's an "I love you."
- There's a time for a phone call,

there's a time to wait
until you're home together

and then there are things
that you talk about over text.

- Fade in on trying to find
a last minute babysitter.

Caroline could do it, but
she has a hard out at 6:15,
she babysits at 6:30 in Larchmont.

Could you jet the hell out
of class and be home at 6:15?
- Yeah!
- Fuck yeah!
- Oooo, wait.
- Fuck no!
- This one's good.
- Okay, taking off, love you.
- I love you, too.
- Goodnight, sweetheart, I miss you.
- I miss you, too, what is your
mom's sign in info for Comcast?
- (laughs) That's a good one.
- (laughing) That's a good one.
- Okay, I'm home now, fade to Andrew
going to Cheryl's at seven.
- Andrew's our dog.
- Okay, coming home now.
- What time do you want the
(mumbling) guy to come on Sunday?
- Any time.
- Okay.
- The British rowing team is here.
- Send photos.
- And then I sent the emoji of the
eggplant that looks phallic.
- What does that mean?
- (laughing) It's like a big boner.
- I know what that is.
- I like the ones that are long streams
of me texting you and you not answering.
- Like what.
- And I just keep going.
- Let's hear it.
- I like this one.
Hello? Hey, can I come in there?
I really have to pee.
I really had to pee before,
but now I really have to pee.
- Do you need anything? Food.
- More cheese for crackers? And apples.
- Okay, have you seen my sunglasses?
- No.
- Are you gonna want dinner tonight?
- Yeah.
- Good.
- I know that every time I don't respond
to a text right away you say, "Hi, cats."

- (laughs) I don't even
remember where that came from.
- This is from, like, two days ago.
Don't be mad, but I bought an original

$40.00 Pakistani "Hollywood
Cop" poster off eBay.
It's fucking beautiful, don't be mad.
- Why would I be mad, that sounds rad.

You should have said, "Don't
be rad-er than this poster."
(laughing)
- Can you turn on the vaporizer?
- Oh my gosh, the mom next to me at

gymnastics is Sophie's
mom and she keeps randomly

making humming sounds
and it's so annoying!
- @#headphones?
- None.

- And then a GIF of Darth
Vader going, "Nooo!"
- (laughing)

- [Voiceover] I'll give you
five bucks to stop texting.
- I'll give you five buck to stop having

a butt in the place where
your face should be.
Oh, wait, you can't, I married a buttface.

- [Voiceover] I can't
believe you said that.
- [Voiceover] It's okay, I love your
buttface and the rest of ya.

- You know how sensitive I
am about my facebuttitis.

comments.author: THE RAMEN BOX

comments.text:
I do not understand why people are still being homophobic assholes and 
complaining all the freaking time. Every single time buzzfeed does a video 
involving couples, they include diverse couples. This includes opposite 
sex, same sex, couples of different races etc. Its an experiment. It would 
be like asking a kindergarten class what their favorite cartoon is and only 
interviewing the red heads. Literally EVERY SINGLE TIME THEY DO A COUPLES 
VIDEO THEY INCLUDE A SAME SEX COUPLE. Why are people still surprised every 
single time they do it? It's like a thing now. Get over it. Move on. They 
will continue doing it so if you have such a problem move on because I want 
to see actual comments and not all these chains of hate. ﻿
comments.author: Kaeli Jewell

comments.text:
My wife and I  like to keep it short... Heres all our textst last week 
(roughly translated from Norwegian).

Monday:
17:20 - Me: otbu20     
*(our shorthand for "On The BUs, nr 20")*
17:21 - Her:  Can U shop. I'll write the shopping list.
17:29: - Me: Ok, ott    
*(short for "On The Tube")*

Tuesday:
08:32 - Her: It's your dad's birthday, send him a text with congratulations 
from us
*(I've already done so, so I ignore this)*
16:54 - Me: otbu20
17:06 - Me: ott

Wednesday:
17:10 - Me: otbu20
17:21 - Me: ott
17:26 - Her: Could you shop?

Thursday:
17:24 - Me: otbu20
17:26 - Her: Could U shop?
17:21 - Me: Yup, ott

Friday:
16:36 - Me: otbu20
16:47 - Me: ott
16:51 - Her: You're early :) can you shop what's on the list?
16:57 - Me:  ok
17:08 - Her: And candy!!!

Etc. etc... =)﻿

comments.text:

couple in their videos they barely show up? It's like they're there to show 
that they support gays but they rarely show up in the video to begin with.

seeing them but then they say like one thing then disappear. ﻿

comments.text:

funniest? Like I don't think they should give gays special treatment and 
add them in the video just because they're gay and yet there be no humor. 
They add them in becaus they're married and if they didn't show up much 
then they weren't completely funny. That's all it has nothing to do with 
them being gay and stuff. Otherwise the couple wouldn't agree to be in the 
video if they were there to be gay ornaments like saying "we are gay 
friendly!". The couple agreed because they're a couple and they're normal.
